# Samuel Adams Warner House

| locmapin     = New York#USA
| built        = 1875
| architect    = Samuel Adams Warner
| architecture = Chalet style cottage
| added        = October 02, 1986
| area         = less than one acre
| mpsub        =

Samuel Adams Warner House is a historic home located at Roslyn in Nassau County, New York.
Description
It was designed by architect Samuel Adams Warner and built about 1875 and is a -story, vernacular Swiss chaletâ€“style frame dwelling on a partially excavated stone basement.  It features a broad, overhanging gable roof with jerkin heads.  An L-shaped gallery projects from the south and west sides, and the gallery deck is embellished by scroll-sawn fascia.
It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1986.
